column1:
Windsorlego,"2019-10-20T12:17:47.677Z","The Little Airport","

I managed to obtain this set from Ebay for a reasonable sum of money.   I see from the instructions booklet that only 10,000 of these were produced so I feel quite pleased that I obtained this.
The booklet is the usual sturdy booklet that you get with the Architecture range and all in black.

There are quite a lot of 1x1 and 1x2 pieces in this set so you will need a pair of nimble fingers!  You start off with doing the base before moving on to the airport building itself. You need to make sure that you haven't missed doing anything before moving on to the next step.
As the majority of the pieces are small it could be easy to miss something during the build so careful scrutiny of each section before moving on is recommended.
Playability doesn't come into this as the set is too small in that respect.
I thoroughly enjoyed making this set and would recommend getting one if you can.  Having never visited Billund Airport I can't say how accurate the set is to it.

,TRUE,5,5,5,1,5

column1: I purchased this set at Billund Airport for 799,95 DKK (approx. €111) on 30 December 2022.
A hard to find set, you can only buy this set when departing from Billund Airport. For me, that was my trip back home, after visiting the LEGO House and Legoland.

Building this set is easy and enjoyable. The microscale techniques are applied very well and the addition of five airplanes are very nice. I believe they represent different airliners that use this airport; KLM, Lufthansa, Ryanair, Air France, and another one I can't identify.

Considering how much this set costs, there really isn't that much in the box. Personally I would've liked to see this set to be bigger and include the runway. Still, it looks very nice on my bookshelf, and makes for a good reminder of my lego trip.
If you happen to visit Billund, and when departing they still happen to have this set, just get it.
